page.title: 17VISITORS' CENTRE, STONEHENGE
page.content: Fargo plantation has been proposed as a vistors' centre and would have the usual facilities, plus a re-construction of the stone circle, giving information to the tourist. A series of footpaths leading the visitor from one point of interest to another have been opened up with walks clearly marked and stiles provided where necessary. The main stumbling block seems to be the close proximity of two busy roads the A303 and A344 - closure of the latter causing controversy amongst local residents. As this road bisects the site its' closure appears inevitable whichever plan is adopted. The site must be improved and a compromise must be reached in which way we develop the site for future generations, but at the same time we must preserve the past.
